title: JSON schema for an FCA process
description:
JSON schema for FCA (Formal Concept Analysis). The schema contains context, concepts and sets of implications.

In Python, an instance can be validated with the function 'validate', provided by the 'jsonschema' package.

object.description: JSON schema for a single object.

attribute.description: JSON schema for a single attribute.

implication.description: JSON schema for a single implication. Premise and conclusion are required, other properties (id, support, confidence) are optional.

id.description: Identifier of the implication. The id can be of any type, e.g. integer or string.

support.$comment: If the support is given, the corresponding context set should be referenced.
support.description: The support of the implication in a specific data set

confidence.$comment: If the confidence is given, the corresponding context should be referenced.
confidence.description: The confidence of the implication in a specific data set

set_of_implications.description: JSON schema for a set of implications in FCA (Formal Concept Analysis). The schema contains information about the set of implications (whether it is a base, the type of the base, additional information).

is_base.description: Indicates, whether the set of implications is a base or not.

base_type.description: Specifies the type of the base, if 'is_base' is true. If the set of implications is not a base, the base_type has to be empty.
base_type.$comment: Further base_type enums can be added.

additional information.description: Information that is additional to the defined properties

if.$comment: If 'is_base' is false, then a property named 'base_type' may not exist.

dependentRequired.$comment: If 'base_type' exists, then 'is_base' has to exist as well.

source.description: In 'source', the source of the context / data can be added.

implication_sets.description: Several sets of implications can be added.

additional_information.description: Information that is additional to the defined properties
